title: Rush metadata file
description: This YAML file holds all of the extension's metadata, such as it's name, description, version related information, etc.

name.title: Extension name
name.description: The user facing name of the extension. This MUST match with the Java class name of the extension.

description.title: Extension description
description.description: A brief description of your extension.

number.title: Extension's version number
number.description: An integer representing the current version of the extension. Use `auto` if you want to auto-increment the value with every release build.

name.description: The name of the current version of the extension.

icon.description: The extension's icon. Can be a local image stored in assets directory or a remote URL. For best results, use an image that is 16Ã—16px.

other.description: A list of all the assets required by this extension (excluding icon image). This could be of anything -- images, text files, archives, etc.

deps.title: Extension dependencies
deps.description: JAR dependencies of the extension. Only add the JARs that are needed during runtime here. Compile-time dependencies are not required to be added; they should only be present in the `deps` directory.

optimize.title: Optimize release build
optimize.description: Indicates whether to optimize the extension while creating a release build or not. You can mark a build as a release build by passing the `--release` flag (abbr: `-r`).

enable.title: Enable Kotlin support
enable.description: Indicates whether to enable Kotlin language support or not for the extension.

enable.title: Enable desugaring
enable.description: Indicates whether to enable desugaring of Java 8 language features. You MUST set it to true if you wish to use Java 8 language features, such as lambda expressions.

desugar_deps.title: Desugar dependencies
desugar_deps.description: If set to true, Rush will try to desugar the dependencies of the extension as well.

optimize.title: Optimize release build
optimize.description: Indicates whether to optimize the extension while creating a release build or not. You can mark a build as a release build by passing the `--release` flag (abbr: `-r`).

license_url.title: Extension license
license_url.description: A remote URL to the license agreement for the end-users of the extension.

license.title: Extension license
license.description: The license agreement for the end-users of the extension. This could be a remote URL or a relative path to a local text document.

min_sdk.title: Extension's minimum Android SDK
min_sdk.description: The minimum version number of the Android SDK the extension needs in order to function properly. This MUST be greater than or equal to `7`.

homepage.title: Extension's homepage
homepage.description: The remote URL of the extension's homepage. This could be a link to the GitHub repository, community post, or the website of the extension.

authors.title: Extension authors
authors.description: A list of all the authors of the extension.
